name: Centro Tecnológico Naval y del Mar
membership: Instituto de Fomento de la Región de Murcia. (http://www.institutofomentomurcia.es/web/portal/oficinas)
memberOrga:
- Spanish maritime Cluster. (http://www.clustermaritimo.es)
- CITEM (Federación de Centros Tecnológicos del al Región de Murcia. (http://www.citem-rm.es)
goal:
CTN is a non-for-profit private association aiming to improve the competitiveness of the overall marine and maritime sector through the development of new technological solutions and technology transfer.

CTN association is made up of a group of Spanish Maritime Companies (SME’s; large-scale enterprises, Universities and Research Institutes) that collaborate on a day to day basis with the most relevant maritime stakeholders. CTN is a member of different organizations of the sector and founder of the Spanish Maritime Cluster (CME).

Our aim is to improve the competitiveness of the overall marine and maritime sector through the development of new technological solutions and technology transfer.

CTN promotes the integration of all the members of the sector with the aim to improve the cooperation and collaboration among them, the search of new business opportunities, the preparation of new innovative solutions and the development of R&D projects.

CTN also encourages the dialogue and communication among different social agents, institutions, official bodies and different administrations, as well as the promotion of the marine culture and traditions of the Region of Murcia.

CTN has five strategic objectives

• Create an atmosphere of cooperation among its members.
• Give more visibility to the sector and represent its common interests.
• Identify new business opportunities.
• Implementate good environmental practices in the marine and maritime sectors.

REMIT:

• Shipping
• Shipbuilding
• Fishing and aquaculture
• Ports and maritime services
• Logistics
• Marine Energy
• Offshore activities
• Recreational nautical sector
• R&D activities
• Education and training
• Navy
• Regional & Local Clustering
• Culture and Heritage Promotion
interests: Climate Action, Development, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Fisheries and Aquaculture, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Transport
